author: superbonaci
body:
Installing powershell on ubuntu 20.04:
````
sudo snap install powershell --classic
powershell 7.0.0 from Microsoft PowerShell✓ installed
````
````
pwsh
Failed to load ���, error: /snap/powershell/104/opt/powershell/../../lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/librt.so.1: undefined symbol: __clock_nanosleep, version GLIBC_PRIVATE
Failed to bind to CoreCLR at '/snap/powershell/104/opt/powershell/'
Failed to create CoreCLR, HRESULT: 0x80008088
````

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
Currently Ubuntu 20.04 is not in .Net 3.1 supported OS list. https://github.com/dotnet/core/blob/master/release-notes/3.1/3.1-supported-os.md You should ask .Net team to add the support before PowerShell could works on the OS.
GitHub
dotnet/core
Home repository for .NET Core. Contribute to dotnet/core development by creating an account on GitHub.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as answered and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

comments.author: nikonthethird
comments.body:
@iSazonov the `dotnet` packages are available for Ubuntu 20.04 as of today :tada: 

Does that mean Powershell can be added to the APT repos now as well?

comments.author: superbonaci
comments.body: This @msftbot is really eager to mark issues as fixed. Why the hell has to close the issue WITHIN 24H???????

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: This was closed at a time when .Net team had not yet expanded support for this version.

title: snap package fails on ubuntu 20.04
